de.dfki.lt.hfc

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.lt.hfc.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean expandProxy
      do we want proxy expansion in the resulting binding table if equivalence reduction has been turned on ? this field is set every time query() is called, depending on whether either SELECT (expandProxy = false) or SELECTALL (expandProxy = true) is used
      protected TupleStore tupleStore
      in order to query, we need a tuple store

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Query(ForwardChainer fc)
      the unary constructor internalizes the tuple store that `sits' inside the forward chainer
      Query(TupleStore tupleStore)
      the unary constructor internalizes the tuple store

      private void internalizeFilter(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> filterClauses, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> varvarIneqs, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> varconstIneqs, java.util.ArrayList<Predicate> predicates, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> nameToId)
      maps surface FILTER form to internal representation, stored in varvarIneqs and varconstIneqs (as used by Calc.restrict) and predicates; NOTE: code does NOT work for NoValue in queries (FILTER), but DOES work for @test in rules SOLUTION: replace QueryParseException by a warning

      preparation phase, before querying the index for each clause; determines the proper vars, don't care vars, relevant positions, equal positions, and the name-to-position mapping
      BindingTable query(java.lang.String query)
      reads in a QDL query and returns a binding table, encoding the result of the query; at the moment (= v2.3), QDL is described by the following EBNF: ::= ::= {"SELECT" | "SELECTALL"} ["DISTINCT"] {"*" | ^+} ::= "?"^+ ::= any NON-whitespace character ::= "WHERE" {"&" }^* ::= ^+ ::= ^+ ::= | ::= | ::= "<" ^+ ">" ::= "\"" ^* "\"" [ "@" | "^^" ] ::= any character, incl.
      private BindingTable queryAndJoin(java.util.ArrayList<int[]> patterns, java.util.ArrayList<Table> tables)
      queries the index for each clause and successively joins the results
      private void renameVariables(BindingTable result, BindingTable next)
      potentially renames internal variable names (negative ints) in next, given result; this requires changing next.nameToPos and next.nameToExternalName

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public BindingTable query(java.lang.String query)
                   throws QueryParseException
        reads in a QDL query and returns a binding table, encoding the result of the query; at the moment (= v2.3), QDL is described by the following EBNF: ::= ::= {"SELECT" | "SELECTALL"} ["DISTINCT"] {"*" | ^+} ::= "?"^+ ::= any NON-whitespace character ::= "WHERE" {"&" }^* ::= ^+ ::= ^+ ::= | ::= | ::= "<" ^+ ">" ::= "\"" ^* "\"" [ "@" | "^^" ] ::= any character, incl. whitespaces, numbers, even '\"' ::= "de" | "en" | ... ::= "" | "" | "" | "" | "" | "" | "" | "" | "" | "" ::= "FILTER" {"&" }^* ::= | ::= "!=" ::= ^* ::= ^+ (e.g., Less, LessEqual) ::= "AGGREGATE" {"&" }^* ::= ^+ "=" ^* ::= ^+ (e.g., Count, CountDistinct, Average, Min, Max, Sum, Identity) note: the reserved keywords ASK, SELECT, SELECTALL, DISTINCT, WHERE, FILTER, and AGGREGATE need _not_ be written uppercase note: it is required that neither filter predicates nor aggregate functions have the same name as the above reserved keywords
        Returns:
        null iff a constant in the query is not known to the tuple store (represents an empty table)
        Throws:
        a - query parse exception iff query is syntactically incorrect
        QueryParseException

                  java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> projectedVars)

      • internalizeWhere

        private java.util.ArrayList<int[]> internalizeWhere(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> whereClauses,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<int[]> patterns,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> nameToId,
                                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> idToName)

        Returns:
        null iff constants in the WHERE clause are NOT known to the tuple store

      • isPredicate

        public static boolean isPredicate(java.lang.String literal)

      • internalizeFilter

        private void internalizeFilter(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> filterClauses,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> varvarIneqs,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> varconstIneqs,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Predicate> predicates,
                     java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> nameToId)
                        throws QueryParseException
        maps surface FILTER form to internal representation, stored in varvarIneqs and varconstIneqs (as used by Calc.restrict) and predicates; NOTE: code does NOT work for NoValue in queries (FILTER), but DOES work for @test in rules SOLUTION: replace QueryParseException by a warning
        Throws:
        QueryParseException
        See Also:
        RuleStore.evaluatePredicates()

      • internalizeAggregate

        private void internalizeAggregate(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> aggregateClauses,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Aggregate> aggregates,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> nameToId,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> idToName,
                        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> projectedVars,
                        java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> foundVars)
                           throws QueryParseException
        maps surface AGGREGATE form to internal representation, stored in aggregates aggregate list is of the following form: ... = ... , where N >= 1 (at least _one_ var) and M >= 0 (potentially _no_ args)
        Throws:
        QueryParseException
